analyzed_text:
Yep for Italian

Il dom 23 feb 2020, 18:40 Terrill Thompson <notifications@github.com> ha
scritto:

> @GERMANOCARELLA <link @rococode
> <link @Egyrs <link @ylahav
> <link @motchie <link
> @jannrobert <link @vierkantemeter
> <link @ShadowBB
> <link @mgmar22 <link
> @JediLin <link @rscano <link
>
> I just added several new words and phrases to the end of each of the
> translation files, all related to search, which previously wasn't
> localized. This is currently only on the develop branch, committed in
> c3cf0ad
> <link
> .
>
> There are essentially two parts that need to be localized, each of which
> is comprised of various smaller parts:
>
>    1. Summary text
>    2. Label for the button that shows the start time for each search
>    result.
>
> A functioning demo of the search interface can be sampled on the Video
> Player with Search
> <link example page.
> That's using the latest official release of Able Player and has now been
> updated on the develop branch, but the text to be translated is the same.
>
> For now, I've added placeholder text in English to all translation files.
> I have questions though about whether it's appropriate to concatenate all
> the parts in the same order for all languages that I'm using for English.
> Here's what I'm doing in English:
>
> ** For summary text: ***
> *Formula:* 'Found ' + numberOfSearchResults + ' matching items.'
> *Example:* Found 12 items.
>
> ** For button labels **
> *Formula:* 'Play at ' + hours + ' hours ' + minutes + ' minutes ' +
> seconds + ' seconds'
> *Example:* Play at 2 hours 12 minutes 17 seconds
>
> If we translate all text that appears in single quotes in the formulas, do
> the formulas work in all languages?
>
> Thanks!
>
